subtitle: it's a good opportunity to talk about

it's interesting when it comes to rosh
hashanah which we just spell abraded a

actually in Jewish thought about New
Year's Rosh Hashanah resolutions it does
say that when a new year starts we
should we have the opportunity to begin
anew and we have the opportunity to take
upon ourselves new things but the idea
the concept which i think is a pretty
modern one in the new age on a new age
it's in a fast-food generation that we
live in the idea that you can just take
a resolution that I think has a lot to
do with the commercial side of it which
is called the self-help industry that
compressed certain buttons magic tricks
everybody selling those different ways
that you can start the new leaf lose
weight or the other different categories
of decisions we make so I'm of the
belief that as many have pointed out
that the more you try to take on new
resolutions the more you fail because
it's far more complicated than just a

a great time to start something new very
difficult to maintain any type of
resolutions because it's not about
willpower and it's not about just making
a decision as to do with far more
complex issues
